fact_check_explanation_title: New antibody tests are not 100% accurate on all measures
fact_check_explanation_summary: It was reported that new antibody tests were 100% accurate, but evaluation of the tests by Public Health England shows this is not the case.

fact_check_explanation_title: What is ‘shielding’ and who needs to do it?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Readers have asked Full Fact to look into the guidance around ‘shielding’ during the Covid-19 pandemic .

fact_check_explanation_title: Claim that extending the Brexit transition period could cost £380 billion is not credible
fact_check_explanation_summary: Most studies into the economic impacts of Brexit show leaving the customs union and single market will mean the UK economy is smaller compared to remaining.

fact_check_explanation_title: Two metres is a little better than one
fact_check_explanation_summary: New research shows that keeping your distance does protect against coronavirus

fact_check_explanation_title: Chris Whitty did not personally receive millions of pounds from the Bill & Melinda Gates foundation
fact_check_explanation_summary: The money was given to the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, where Chris Whitty worked.

fact_check_explanation_title: We still don’t know if the UK does the most Covid-19 tests in Europe
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister claimed “we test more than virtually any country in Europe.” The UK appears to test more than most.

fact_check_explanation_title: This is how you can verify you are actually being contacted by the government’s Test and Trace service
fact_check_explanation_summary: Tracers will not ask for personal information such as financial details or online logins.

fact_check_explanation_title: The figure of 1 million children not returning to school is uncertain
fact_check_explanation_summary: Teachers were surveyed between 7 and 17 May on whether they thought families would send their children back to school when they reopened.

fact_check_explanation_title: SAGE did not advise against reopening schools on 1 June
fact_check_explanation_summary: This was the opinion of the Independent SAGE, who are a different group of scientists.

fact_check_explanation_title: No, the Mail didn’t use an old photo of Jeremy Corbyn to claim he wasn’t social distancing on his birthday
fact_check_explanation_summary: The photo is from 2020 as the Mail claimed and first appeared on a Facebook group for canal boat owners.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 may not be a “high consequence infectious disease”, but it is a real emergency
fact_check_explanation_summary: The new coronavirus can cause many thousands of deaths even though Covid-19 is no longer considered a “high consequence infectious disease”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can hand sanitiser catch fire in a hot car?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts suggest that an image shows the aftermath of a fire started by a bottle of alcohol antibacterial hand gel left in a hot car.
